_explanation.hierarchical: sub_epics can contain: nested sub_epics or story_groups. sequential_order is always an integer (1, 2, 3, 4) - unique within parent, no decimals.
_explanation.connector: Story groups: 'and' or 'or' (null for first group). Stories within groups: 'and' or 'or' (null for first story). Epics and sub_epics don't have connectors.
_explanation.domain_placement: domain_concepts: 'local' if relevant to single sub_epic, 'global' if relevant to multiple sub_epics. Place at most specific level (local preferred), but elevate to parent if used by multiple children.
_explanation.exploration_additions: Stories include: optional, priority, Steps, acceptance_criteria. Story groups are used instead of features.
_explanation.acceptance_criteria_format:
Each acceptance criteria is a SINGLE string containing one WHEN/THEN pair. Format: "WHEN [condition]
THEN [outcome]" or "WHEN [condition]
THEN [outcome] AND [additional outcome]". WHEN and THEN must be on separate lines (use 
 for newline). THEN and its AND must be together on the same line. Each WHEN condition starts a new acceptance criteria. Example: ["WHEN user selects tokens
THEN system highlights tokens AND tokens are stored", "WHEN user selects zero tokens
THEN system shows error message"]
_explanation.increments_structure: The 'increments' section is a MINIMAL REFERENCE VIEW. Stories in increments contain ONLY: name, users (optional), sequential_order. All story details (story_type, connector, Steps, acceptance_criteria, etc.) come from the main 'epics' section. Increments are just a copy of the outline view at the story level to map which stories belong to which increment.
